intro: Pandiaka andongensis, commonly known as the Andong pandiaka, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South Korea. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related shrubs. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and requires a cool, moist climate. Due to habitat loss, Pandiaka andongensis is considered endangered and is protected in several conservation areas.
